document_title: Fournier syndrome: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Anyone of any age is at risk for Fournier syndrome. However, men are 10 times more likely to get the disease than women. In addition, high-risk groups include: (3)
Diabetes: About 20 - 70% of cases with Founier also have diabetes.; Alcohol abuse: About 25 - 50% of people with Fournier disease have the habit of abusing alcohol; Cardiovascular disorders.; Cirrhosis.; HIV.; High Blood Pressure; CKD.
In addition, some subjects are also in the risk group including:
From 50 years old or older.; People with obesity; People with the habit of smoking; The patient is taking steroids or is undergoing chemotherapy.; Injury.; Immunosuppressive.
subsection_title: hoi chung fournier.json. Who does Fournier syndrome affect?
